Changes for AWS ECS Deployment
Dockerfile: No changes needed. Your current multi-stage Dockerfile (Node builder → runtime with serve for static React) works perfectly for ECS. It exposes port 3000, which we'll map in the ECS task definition.
YAML Changes Summary:

Name: Updated to "CI/CD Pipeline (AWS ECS)".
Triggers: Kept main for production; added staging, dev for multi-env.
Permissions: Added id-token: write for OIDC auth.
CI Job: Kept all (tests, build, artifact, Docker to GHCR). But for ECS, we push Docker to AWS ECR (not GHCR) in CD.
CodeQL: Kept.
CD Job:

Renamed deploy-prod to deploy-ecs.
Configure AWS credentials with OIDC (secure, no keys).
Login to ECR, build/tag/push Docker image to ECR (using ECR registry).
Download task definition JSON from AWS, update with new image URI.
Deploy to ECS service (wait for stability).
Smoke test: Updated to ECS load balancer URL (e.g., http://your-alb-1234567890.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com).


Preview Job: Removed (ECS doesn't have native previews; use PR artifacts if needed).
Failure Notify: Kept commented.
Envs/Secrets: See setup below.

AWS Setup (One-Time, Before Pushing YAML):

Create ECS Cluster: aws ecs create-cluster --cluster-name my-react-cluster.
Create ECR Repo: aws ecr create-repository --repository-name my-react-app.
Create Task Definition: JSON file (see below) → aws ecs register-task-definition --cli-input-json file://task-definition.json.
Create ECS Service: Fargate/EC2, map port 3000, attach ALB if public.
GitHub Secrets (Repo → Settings → Secrets):

AWS_REGION: e.g., us-east-1.
AWS_ACCOUNT_ID: Your AWS account ID.
ECR_REPOSITORY: my-react-app.
ECS_CLUSTER: my-react-cluster.
ECS_SERVICE: my-react-service.
ECS_TASK_DEFINITION: task-definition.json (path in repo).


OIDC: Repo → Settings → Actions → Add AWS role ARN (create IAM role with ECS/ECR policies, trust GitHub OIDC provider).
Task Definition JSON (add to repo root as task-definition.json):
json{
  "family": "my-react-task",
  "networkMode": "awsvpc",
  "requiresCompatibilities": ["FARGATE"],
  "cpu": "256",
  "memory": "512",
  "executionRoleArn": "arn:aws:iam::ACCOUNT:role/ecsTaskExecutionRole",
  "taskRoleArn": "arn:aws:iam::ACCOUNT:role/ecsTaskRole",
  "containerDefinitions": [
    {
      "name": "react-app",
      "image": "placeholder",
      "portMappings": [{ "containerPort": 3000 }],
      "essential": true
    }
  ]
}


Benefits: Docker from GHCR/CD → ECR push → ECS update → Zero-downtime deploy.

Complete Modified File: .github/workflows/ci-cd.yml
yamlname: CI/CD Pipeline (AWS ECS)

# ──────────────────────────────────────
# TRIGGERS
# ──────────────────────────────────────
on:
  push:
    branches: [ main, staging, dev ]
  pull_request:
    types: [ opened, synchronize, reopened ]
  workflow_dispatch:          # manual run from UI

# ──────────────────────────────────────
# CONCURRENCY – cancel old runs
# ──────────────────────────────────────
concurrency:
  group: ${{ github.workflow }}-${{ github.ref }}
  cancel-in-progress: true

# ──────────────────────────────────────
# PERMISSIONS (least-privilege)
# ──────────────────────────────────────
permissions:
  contents: read
  actions: read
  id-token: write  # For AWS OIDC auth
  security-events: write   # CodeQL
  statuses: write          # commit status
  deployments: write       # ECS
  pull-requests: write     # PR comment
  packages: write          # GHCR push

# ──────────────────────────────────────
# JOBS
# ──────────────────────────────────────
jobs:
  # -------------------------------------------------
  # 1. CI – build, test, lint, upload artifact
  # -------------------------------------------------
  ci:
    name: CI – Node ${{ matrix.node }}
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    strategy:
      matrix:
        node: [18.x, 20.x, 22.x]
      fail-fast: false
    outputs:
      # expose a flag for CD (true only on main + success)
      deploy-prod: ${{ steps.set-deploy.outputs.deploy-prod }}
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0

      - name: Setup Node ${{ matrix.node }}
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ matrix.node }}

      - name: Cache npm
        uses: actions/cache@v4
        id: cache
        with:
          path: |
            ~/.npm
            node_modules
          key: ${{ runner.os }}-npm-${{ hashFiles('package-lock.json') }}
          restore-keys: ${{ runner.os }}-npm-

      # FIXED: Use npm ci instead of npm install
      - name: Install
        run: npm ci

      - name: Lint
        run: npm run lint

      - name: Test
        run: npm test -- --coverage --watchAll=false

      - name: Build
        run: npm run build

      - name: Upload artifact
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: react-build-node-${{ matrix.node }}
          path: build/
          retention-days: 7

      # === NEW: DOCKER BUILD WITH CACHE ===
      - name: Set up Docker Buildx
        uses: docker/setup-buildx-action@v3

      - name: Generate Docker metadata (auto-lowercases tags)
        id: meta
        uses: docker/metadata-action@v5
        with:
          images: ghcr.io/${{ github.repository }}
          tags: |
            type=raw,value=latest,enable={{is_default_branch}}
            type=sha

      - name: Cache Docker layers
        uses: actions/cache@v4
        with:
          path: /tmp/.buildx-cache
          key: ${{ runner.os }}-buildx-${{ github.sha }}
          restore-keys: |
            ${{ runner.os }}-buildx-

      - name: Login to GHCR
        uses: docker/login-action@v3
        with:
          registry: ghcr.io
          username: ${{ github.actor }}
          password: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}

      - name: Build and push Docker image
        uses: docker/build-push-action@v6  # Updated to latest v6
        with:
          context: .
          file: Dockerfile
          push: true
          tags: ${{ steps.meta.outputs.tags }}
          cache-from: type=local,src=/tmp/.buildx-cache
          cache-to: type=local,dest=/tmp/.buildx-cache,mode=max
          sbom: true  # Optional: Generate SBOM for security

      # ---- set output flag for CD (main + success) ----
      - name: Set deploy-prod flag
        id: set-deploy
        run: |
          if [[ "${{ github.ref }}" == "refs/heads/main" && "${{ job.status }}" == "success" ]]; then
            echo "deploy-prod=true" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          else
            echo "deploy-prod=false" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          fi

  # -------------------------------------------------
  # 2. SECURITY – CodeQL (always runs, even if CI fails)
  # -------------------------------------------------
  codeql:
    needs: ci
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      security-events: write
      actions: read
      contents: read
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Initialize CodeQL
        uses: github/codeql-action/init@v3
        with:
          languages: javascript-typescript
          queries: security-and-quality

      - name: Analyze
        uses: github/codeql-action/analyze@v3

  # -------------------------------------------------
  # 3. CD – Production (only on main + CI success)
  # -------------------------------------------------
  deploy-ecs:
    needs: [ci, codeql]
    if: needs.ci.outputs.deploy-prod == 'true'
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    environment: production
    env:
      AWS_REGION: ${{ secrets.AWS_REGION }}
      ECR_REPOSITORY: ${{ secrets.ECR_REPOSITORY }}
      ECS_CLUSTER: ${{ secrets.ECS_CLUSTER }}
      ECS_SERVICE: ${{ secrets.ECS_SERVICE }}
      ECS_TASK_DEFINITION: ${{ secrets.ECS_TASK_DEFINITION }}
      CONTAINER_NAME: react-app
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Configure AWS credentials
        uses: aws-actions/configure-aws-credentials@v4
        with:
          role-to-assume: arn:aws:iam::${{ secrets.AWS_ACCOUNT_ID }}:role/GitHubActionsRole
          aws-region: ${{ secrets.AWS_REGION }}
          role-session-name: GitHubActions-EC2

      - name: Login to Amazon ECR
        id: login-ecr
        uses: aws-actions/amazon-ecr-login@v2

      - name: Build, tag, and push image to Amazon ECR
        id: build-image
        env:
          ECR_REGISTRY: ${{ steps.login-ecr.outputs.registry }}
          IMAGE_TAG: ${{ github.sha }}
        run: |
          docker build -t $ECR_REGISTRY/$ECR_REPOSITORY:$IMAGE_TAG .
          docker push $ECR_REGISTRY/$ECR_REPOSITORY:$IMAGE_TAG
          echo "image=$ECR_REGISTRY/$ECR_REPOSITORY:$IMAGE_TAG" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT

      - name: Fill in the new image ID in the Amazon ECS task definition
        id: task-def
        uses: aws-actions/amazon-ecs-render-task-definition@v1
        with:
          task-definition: ${{ env.ECS_TASK_DEFINITION }}
          container-name: ${{ env.CONTAINER_NAME }}
          image: ${{ steps.build-image.outputs.image }}

      - name: Deploy Amazon ECS task definition
        uses: aws-actions/amazon-ecs-deploy-task-definition@v1
        with:
          task-definition: ${{ steps.task-def.outputs.task-definition }}
          service: ${{ env.ECS_SERVICE }}
          cluster: ${{ env.ECS_CLUSTER }}
          wait-for-service-stability: true

      # FIXED: Debug ECS deploy
      - name: Debug ECS Outputs
        run: |
          echo "Deployment successful to ECS service: ${{ env.ECS_SERVICE }}"

      # FIXED: Use ECS load balancer URL for smoke test
      - name: Smoke test (ECS)
        run: |
          URL="http://your-alb-1234567890.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com"  # CHANGE TO YOUR ALB DNS
          echo "Testing ECS: $URL"
          sleep 30  # Wait for ECS rollout
          curl -f -L --max-time 30 "$URL" || exit 1

      # - name: Slack – prod success
      #   uses: slackapi/slack-github-action@v1.26.0
      #   with:
      #     payload: |
      #       { "text": "Production deployed to ECS!\n<${{ env.ECS_SERVICE }}|View Service> | <${{ github.server_url }}/${{ github.repository }}/actions/runs/${{ github.run_id }}|Run>" }
      #   env:
      #     SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL: ${{ secrets.SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL }}

  # -------------------------------------------------
  # 4. CD – Preview (PRs only)
  # -------------------------------------------------
  deploy-preview:
    needs: ci
    if: github.event_name == 'pull_request' && needs.ci.result == 'success'
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    environment: preview
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Download artifact
        uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: react-build-node-20.x
          path: build/

      - name: Deploy Preview
        id: vercel
        uses: amondnet/vercel-action@v25
        with:
          vercel-token: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_TOKEN }}
          vercel-org-id: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_ORG_ID }}
          vercel-project-id: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_PROJECT_ID }}
          vercel-args: '--prebuilt'  # Safe for preview domains
          alias-domains: pr-${{ github.event.pull_request.number }}.vercel.app
        env:
          VERCEL_ENV: preview

      - name: Smoke test (Preview)
        run: |
          URL="${{ steps.vercel.outputs.preview-url }}"
          if [ -z "$URL" ]; then
            echo "Error: No preview URL"
            exit 1
          fi
          echo "Testing preview: $URL"
          sleep 15
          curl -f -L --max-time 30 "$URL" || exit 1

      - name: Comment PR
        uses: actions/github-script@v7
        with:
          script: |
            github.rest.issues.createComment({
              issue_number: context.issue.number,
              owner: context.repo.owner,
              repo: context.repo.repo,
              body: `Preview ready: ${{ steps.vercel.outputs.preview-url }}`
            })

      # - name: Slack – preview
      #   uses: slackapi/slack-github-action@v1.26.0
      #   with:
      #     payload: |
      #       { "text": "Preview for PR #${{ github.event.pull_request.number }}\n<${{ steps.vercel.outputs.preview-url }}|Open> | <${{ github.server_url }}/${{ github.repository }}/actions/runs/${{ github.run_id }}|Run>" }
      #   env:
      #     SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL: ${{ secrets.SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL }}

  # -------------------------------------------------
  # 5. NOTIFY ON ANY FAILURE
  # ──────────────────────────────────────
  # notify-failure:
  #   needs: [ci, codeql, deploy-ecs, deploy-preview]
  #   if: failure()
  #   runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  #   steps:
  #     - name: Slack – failure
  #       uses: slackapi/slack-github-action@v1.26.0
  #       with:
  #         payload: |
  #           { "text": ":fire: *CI/CD failed* on `${{ github.ref_name }}`\n<${{ github.server_url }}/${{ github.repository }}/actions/runs/${{ github.run_id }}|View Run>" }
  #       env:
  #         SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL: ${{ secrets.SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL }}
